channel.title: Off The Hook
channel.description: Off The Hook a podcast from 2600: The Hacker Quarterly. It discusses the hacker's view of the emerging technology, and the threats posed by an increasingly Orwellian society. Hear updates on security flaws from the hacker perspective, as well as the latest news from within the hacker community. Follow us on Twitter @HackerRadioShow and Mastodon @OffTheHook@hackers.town
channel.copyright: Copyright 1995-2023 2600 Enterprises, Inc. All Rights Reserved.
channel.itunes:author: 2600 Enterprises

item.title: Off The Hook - Sep 20, 2023
item.description: The problem with Gmail's spam filters, Google ruined YouTube, the problem with Twitter, the problem with Mastodon, high profile Twitter accounts hacked, International Criminal Court hacked after vowing to prosecute cyber crime, remembering KRT_.
item.author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)
item.itunes:author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)

item.title: Off The Hook - Sep 06, 2023
item.description: WBAI's origins, why radio is better than podcasts, examples of some of the programming on WBAI, notable events in WBAI's history, WBAI has survived multiple takeover attempts, reaction to an April Fools prank, how Off The Hook archives can inspire others, how everyone on the panel found their way to WBAI, WBAI has survived multiple disasters.
item.author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)
item.itunes:author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)

item.title: Off The Hook - Aug 30, 2023
item.description: Alex is in Croatia, news in Canada blocked by tech giants in response to new law, OMNY exposes data that can be used to track NYC subway riders' movements, FAA begins implementing new Remote ID rule for tracking drones.
item.author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)
item.itunes:author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)

item.title: Off The Hook - Aug 23, 2023
item.description: Alex is in Slovenia, Dildog, Medus4 and The Gibson join the panel to discuss their Veilid project, how the framework reduces costs and secures data for apps built on top of it, The Gibson's motivation for creating hackers.town, reaction to the project since it was announced, user experience, design considerations that went into Veilid, explaining Cult of the Dead Cow, how Veilid can protect against some of the more sinister use cases of personal data, addressing safety of the framework, where the name came from.
item.author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)
item.itunes:author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)

item.title: Off The Hook - Aug 09, 2023
item.description: Alex is in Las Vegas for Defcon, remembering Cheshire Catalyst, the WBAI website is down, Twitter fined for delay in complying with search warrant for Trump's account records, security breach exposes UK voters' data.
item.author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)
item.itunes:author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)

item.title: Off The Hook - Aug 02, 2023
item.description: MTA to experiment with artificial intelligence, Twitter sues Center for Countering Digital Hate over lost advertising, Mastodon server compromised when admin's home was raided by FBI on unrelated charges, NYPD testing new radio encryption system.
item.author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)
item.itunes:author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)

item.title: Off The Hook - Jul 26, 2023
item.description: Remembering Kevin Mitnick, masks at the first HOPE conference, the Free Kevin movement, Kevin's business cards, the Freedom Downtime documentary, the Takedown protests, listener mail, The New York Times' role in demonizing Kevin, how hackers first found out that the FBI was looking for Kevin, news of Kevin's capture.
item.author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)
item.itunes:author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)

item.title: Off The Hook - Jul 05, 2023
item.description: Alex is back in the country, Emmanuel and Kyle are on assignment, The_Gibson joins the panel to discuss the fediverse, Twitter restricts access to logged in users only, how the fediverse differs from Twitter, Threads might disrupt the fediverse, Google might scrape everything you post online to train it's AI, a preview of a privacy project by The_Gibson and Cult of the Dead Cow.
item.author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)
item.itunes:author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)

item.title: Off The Hook - Jun 28, 2023
item.description: Alex is in London, Emmanuel and Kyle are in the Yukon, Greg Newby joins the panel, communicating via Starlink, radio telephones, Greg ran in the Denali135, communications systems for the middle of nowhere, Alex attended the Chelsea Arts Club Ball, visiting Canadian radio stations, Canadian wildfires are still a problem, Facebook to block news content in Canada, smartphone emergency call issues, Fort Worth systems hacked over state's laws against gender affirming care.
item.author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)
item.itunes:author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)

item.title: Off The Hook - Jun 14, 2023
item.description: Skype problems, Emmanuel and Kyle are on assignment, the Reddit blackout, volt4ire joins the panel, an update on the ChatGPT lawyer story, EU takes first steps toward AI regulation, Hollywood writers' concerns over AI, Amazon Fire kids tablet used to stalk security pro, listener mail.
item.author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)
item.itunes:author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)
